result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Derail McGinnis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

16A 020970/reversed on 7/26/2016 to correct JOC.

Defendant Anthony Derail McGinnis in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Defendant Anthony Derail McGinnis in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.

The Court sentenced defendant to serve 122 DAYS in the House of Corrections,  with credit for 122 days time served, making this a time served disposition.  

-Court ordered defendant pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments out of cash bail on deposit.  Remaining balance due and owing to be paid during term of extended supervision on COUNT 2 in 15CF4605; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Court waived DNA sample due to DNA sample assessed on 15CF4605.  Defendant to pay the mandatory surcharges during term of extended supervision on COUNT 2 in case 15CF4605 COUNT; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.  

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Sheet

Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
